poem:
Title: The Fossil Subdued 

Gas erupts no more, beneath Biden's stand,
As "Carbon mega bombs" tremble in his hand.
What tales will future children glean,
From the White House's chilly sheen?
Shackled projects, their roars confined,
Reflect a world's worry, entwined.
Echoes of a greener vow,
Begin here, begin now.
